title: Voters Have Expanded Medicaid in 6 States. Is South Dakota Next?
description: Ten years after the Supreme Court ruled that states did not have to expand Medicaid, the politics are changing in states like South Dakota, where rural hospitals and nursing homes are struggling.
dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
media:credit: Tim Gruber for The New York Times
media:description: An unlikely coalition of farmers, business leaders, hospital executives and clergy members have coalesced around a ballot measure that would enshrine Medicaid expansion in the South Dakota Constitution.
